required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Insulin on Wound Healing-A Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Insulin on Wound Healing- A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized controlled trial examining the effect of insulin on wound healing in both diabetics and non diabetic patients in a local health center in Bahrain.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a double blinded RCT comparing the effect of insulin on wound healing in both diabetics and non diabetics.
The study will run in primary care setting in Bahrain. The aim of this study is to heal wound in an innovative way. and the Objective: to evaluate the effect of topical insulin administration on wound healing.
All adult patients with skin wounds attending primary health care center will be included in the study. Patients with acute and chronic wounds of the upper and lower extremities will be eligible to participate.

primary_outcome.description: Rate of wound healing will be calculated as the difference between the primary and final wound area in mm as a function of healing time (in days) and reported as mm/day.

arm_group.description: Before starting the therapeutic procedure, all wounds will be fully washed with normal saline. Group A patients will receive 10 units (0.1 mL) of regular insulin (manufactured by novo nordisk) in solution with 1 cc of normal saline 0.9% for each 10 cm of wound. The solution will be sprayed on the wound surface with an insulin syringe needle, once daily. The patients in this arm will receive conventional therapy.
Before starting the therapeutic procedure, all wounds will be fully washed with normal saline Group B patients will receive conventional topical application without insulin

intervention.description: Adding insulin to conventional wound treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients with Texas 1 and 2 wound criteria
Exclusion Criteria: Texas 3 and 4 wound criteria
-

responsible_party.investigator_title: Central Diabetes clinic coordinator in PHC

patient_data.ipd_description: all collected IPD will be shared
